A Minimal Book Example Chapter 1 Prerequisites

A Minimal Book Example Ito, Sachio 2020-08-06 Chapter 1 Prerequisites This is a sample book written in Markdown. You can use anything that Pandoc’s Markdown supports, e.g., a math equation \(a^2 + b^2 = c^2\). The bookdown package can be installed from CRAN or Github: install.packages("bookdown") # or the development version # devtools::install_github("rstudio/bookdown") Remember each Rmd file contains one and only one chapter, and a chapter is defined by the first-level heading #. To compile this example to PDF, you need XeLaTeX. You are recommended to install TinyTeX (which includes XeLaTeX): https://yihui.org/tinytex/.

Chapter 2 Practice: Rendering ‘Shiki-to-Waka’ 2.1 Snippet 2.1.1 底本 図書カード：子規と和歌 2.1.2 Download file url <- "https://www.aozora.gr.jp/cards/000058/files/57469_ruby_65939.zip" file_path <- rjavacmecab::aozora( url, directory = "" ) text <- readLines(file_path, encoding = "UTF-8") unlink(file_path) dplyr::glimpse(text) #> chr [1:23] "子規と和歌" "伊藤左千夫" "" "" ... 2.2 Output nirvash(text, height = "90%")
